==Events==
* [[222]] &ndash; [[Pope Callixtus I]] is killed by a mob in Rome's [[Trastevere]] after a 5-year reign in which he had stabilized the Saturday fast three times per year, with no food, [[oil]], or [[wine]] to be consumed on those days. Callixtus is succeeded by cardinal [[Pope Urban I|Urban I]].
*[[1066]] &ndash; [[Norman Conquest]]: [[Battle of Hastings]] &ndash; In England on [[Senlac Hill]], seven miles from [[Hastings]], the [[Normans|Norman]] forces of [[William the Conqueror]] defeat the [[Anglo-Saxons|English]] army and kill King [[Harold II of England]].
*[[1322]] &ndash; [[Robert the Bruce]] of Scotland defeats [[King Edward II]] of England at [[Battle of Old Byland|Byland]], forcing Edward to accept Scotland's independence.
*[[1465]] &ndash; [[Wallachian]] [[voivode]] [[Radu cel Frumos]], younger brother of [[Vlad Ţepeş]], issues a [[writ]] from his residence in [[Bucharest]]
*[[1582]] &ndash; Because of the implementation of the [[Gregorian calendar]] this day does not exist in this year in Italy, Poland, Portugal and Spain.
*[[1586]] &ndash; [[Mary, Queen of Scots]], goes on trial for conspiracy against [[Elizabeth I of England]].
*[[1656]] &ndash; [[Massachusetts]] enacts the first punitive legislation against the [[Religious Society of Friends]] (Quakers). The marriage of church-and-state in [[Puritan]]ism makes them regard the Quakers as spiritually apostate and politically subversive.
*[[1758]] &ndash; [[Seven Years' War]]: Austria defeats [[Prussia]] at the [[Battle of Hochkirk]].
*[[1773]] &ndash; The first recorded [[Ministry (government department)|Ministry]] of [[Education]], the [[Komisja Edukacji Narodowej]] (Polish for ''Commission of National Education''), is formed in the [[Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth]].
*  1773   &ndash; Just before the beginning of the [[American Revolutionary War]], several of the [[British East India Company]]'s tea ships are set ablaze at the old [[seaport]] of [[Annapolis, Maryland]].
*[[1805]] &ndash; [[Battle of Elchingen]], France defeats Austria.
*[[1806]] &ndash; [[Battle of Jena-Auerstädt]] France defeats [[Prussia]].
*[[1808]] &ndash; The [[Republic of Ragusa]] is annexed by France.
*[[1812]] &ndash; Work on London's [[Regent's Canal]] starts.
*[[1840]] &ndash; The [[Maronite]] leader [[Bashir II]] surrenders to the [[British Army]] and then is sent into exile on the islands of [[Malta]].
*[[1843]] &ndash; The British arrest the Irish nationalist [[Daniel O'Connell]] for conspiracy to commit crimes.
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Bristoe Station]] &ndash; [[Army of the Confederate States of America|Confederate troops]] under the command of General [[Robert E. Lee]] fail to drive the [[U.S. Army|American Union Army]] completely out of [[Virginia]].
*[[1882]] &ndash; [[University of the Punjab]] is founded in a part of India that later became [[West Pakistan]].
*[[1884]] &ndash; The American [[inventor]], [[George Eastman]], receives a [[U.S. Government]] [[patent]] on his new paper-strip [[photographic film]].
*[[1888]] &ndash; [[Louis Le Prince]] films first motion picture: ''[[Roundhay Garden Scene]]''.
*[[1898]] &ndash; The steamer ship [[SS Mohegan|SS ''Mohegan'']] sinks after impacting [[the Manacles]] near [[Cornwall]], United Kingdom, killing 106.
*[[1908]] &ndash; The [[Chicago Cubs]] defeat the [[Detroit Tigers]], 2-0, clinching the [[World Series]]. It would be their last one to date.
*[[1910]] &ndash; The English aviator [[Claude Grahame-White]] lands his [[Farman Aircraft]] biplane on Executive Avenue near the [[White House]] in [[Washington, D.C.]].
*[[1912]] &ndash; While campaigning in [[Milwaukee, Wisconsin]], the former [[President of the United States]], [[Theodore Roosevelt]], is shot and mildly wounded by [[John Schrank]], a mentally-disturbed saloon keeper. With the fresh [[wound]] in his chest, and the bullet still within it, Mr. Roosevelt still carries out his scheduled [[public speech]].
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[Senghenydd Colliery Disaster]], the United Kingdom's worst coal mining accident, occurs, and it claims the lives of 439 [[miner]]s.
*[[1915]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: The [[Kingdom of Bulgaria]] joins the [[Central Powers]].
*[[1920]] &ndash; Part of [[Pechengsky District|Petsamo Province]] is ceded by the [[Soviet Union]] to Finland.
*[[1925]] &ndash; An Anti-French uprising in French-occupied [[Damascus, Syria]]. (All French inhabitants flee the city.)
*[[1926]] &ndash; The [[children's literature|children's book]] ''[[Winnie-the-Pooh]]'', by [[A. A. Milne]], is first published.
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[Nazi Germany]] withdraws from [[The League of Nations]].
*[[1938]] &ndash; The first flight of the [[Curtiss Aircraft Company]]'s [[P-40 Warhawk]] [[fighter plane]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; The {{GS|U-47|1938|6}} sinks the British battleship {{HMS|Royal Oak|08|6}} within her harbour at [[Scapa Flow]], Scotland.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[Balham tube station#World War II|Balham underground station disaster]] in London, England, occurs during the Nazi [[Luftwaffe]] [[The Blitz|air raids on Great Britain]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; Prisoners at the [[Nazi Germany|Nazi German]] [[Sobibor extermination camp]] in Poland revolt against the Germans, killing eleven SS guards, and wounding many more. About 300 of the Sobibor Camp's 600 prisoners escape, and about 50 of these survive the end of the war.
*  1943   &ndash; The American [[Eighth Air Force]] loses 60 [[B-17 Flying Fortress]] [[heavy bomber]]s in aerial combat during the [[Second Raid on Schweinfurt|second mass-daylight air raid on the Schweinfurt]] [[ball-bearing]] [[factories]] in western [[Nazi Germany]].
*  1943   &ndash; [[José P. Laurel]] takes the oath of office as President of the [[Philippines]] ([[Second Philippine Republic]]).
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[Athens, Greece]], is liberated by [[British Army]] troops entering the city as the [[Wehrmacht]] pulls out during [[World War II]]. This clears the way for the Greek government-in-exile to return to its historic [[capital city]], with [[George Papandreou (senior)|George Papandreou, Sr.]], as the [[head-of-government]].
*  1944   &ndash; Linked to a [[20 July plot|plot to assassinate Adolf Hitler]], Field Marshal [[Erwin Rommel]] is forced to commit suicide.
*[[1947]] &ndash; Captain [[Chuck Yeager]] of the [[U.S. Air Force]] flies a [[Bell X-1]] [[rocket]]-powered [[experimental aircraft]], the ''[[Glamorous Glennis]]'', faster than the [[speed of sound]] - over the high [[desert]] of [[Southern California]] - and becomes the first [[aviator|pilot]] and the first [[airplane]] to do so in level flight.
*[[1949]] &ndash; Eleven leaders of the [[American Communist Party]] are convicted, after a nine-month trial in a [[Federal District Court]], of conspiring to advocate the violent overthrow of the [[U.S. Federal Government]].
*  1949   &ndash; [[Chinese Civil War]]: [[People's Liberation Army|Chinese Communist forces]] occupy the city of [[Guangzhou]] (Canton), in [[Guangdong]], China.
*[[1952]] &ndash; [[Korean War]]: [[United Nations]] and South Korean forces launch [[Operation Showdown]] against Chinese strongholds at the [[Iron Triangle (Korea)|Iron Triangle]]. The resulting [[Battle of Triangle Hill]] is the biggest and bloodiest battle of 1952.
*[[1956]] &ndash; Dr. [[B. R. Ambedkar]], the Indian [[Dalit (outcaste)|Untouchable caste]] leader, converts to [[Buddhism]] along with 385,000 of his followers (see [[Neo-Buddhism]]).
*[[1957]] &ndash; [[Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom|Queen Elizabeth II]] becomes the first [[Monarchy in Canada|Canadian Monarch]] to open up an annual session of the [[Parliament of Canada|Canadian Parliament]], presenting her [[Speech from the Throne]] in [[Ottawa, Canada]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; The American [[U.S. Atomic Energy Commission|Atomic Energy Commission]], with supporting military units, carries out an underground [[nuclear weapon test]] at the [[Nevada Test Site]], just north of [[Las Vegas, Nevada]].
*  1958   &ndash; The [[District of Columbia]]'s Bar Association votes to accept [[African-American]]s as member [[attorney at law|attorneys]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; The [[Cuban Missile Crisis]] begins: A [[U.S. Air Force]] [[Lockheed U-2|U-2 reconnaissance plane]] and its [[aviator|pilot]] fly over the island of [[Cuba]] and take [[photographs]] of [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] missiles capable of carrying [[nuclear warhead]]s being installed and erected in Cuba.
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[Leonid Brezhnev]] becomes the [[General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union|General Secretary]] of the [[Communist Party of the Soviet Union]], and thereby, along with his allies - such as [[Alexei Kosygin]] - the leader of the [[Union of Soviet Socialist Republics]] (USSR), ousting the former monolithic leader [[Nikita Khrushchev]], and sending him into retirement as a [[nonperson]] in the USSR.
*[[1966]] &ndash; The city of [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]], begins the operation of its underground [[Montreal Metro]] [[rapid-transit|rapid-transit system]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; The [[Vietnam War]]: The folk singer [[Joan Baez]] is arrested concerning a physical blockade of the [[U.S. Army]]'s induction center in [[Oakland, California]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: 27 soldiers are arrested at the [[Presidio of San Francisco]] in [[California]] for their peaceful protest of stockade conditions and the [[Vietnam War]].
*  1968   &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: The [[United States Department of Defense]] announces that the [[U.S. Army]] and [[U.S. Marine Corps]] will send about 24,000 soldiers and Marines back to [[Vietnam]] for involuntary second tours of duty in the combat zone there.
*  1968   &ndash; [[Apollo program]]: The first live TV [[broadcasting|broadcast]], by American astronauts in [[Low Earth orbit|orbit]], was performed by the [[Apollo 7]] crew.
*  1968   &ndash; An [[earthquake]] rated at 6.8 on the [[Richter Scale]] destroys the Australian town of [[Meckering, Western Australia]], and it also ruptures all nearby main [[highway]]s and [[railroad]]s.
*  1968   &ndash; [[Jim Hines]] of the United States of America becomes the first man ever to break the so-called "ten-second barrier" in the [[100 metres|100-meter sprint]] in the [[Summer Olympic Games]] held in Mexico City with a time of 9.95 seconds.
*[[1969]] &ndash; The United Kingdom introduces the [[British Fifty Pence coin|British fifty-pence coin]], which replaces, over the following years, the British ten-[[shilling]] note, in anticipation of the [[decimalization]] of the [[British currency]] in [[1971]], and the abolition of the shilling as a unit of currency anywhere in the world.
*[[1973]] &ndash; In the [[Thammasat student uprising]] over [[:th:เหตุการณ์ 14 ตุลา|100,000 people protest]] in [[Thailand]] against the [[Thanom Kittikachorn|Thanom]] military government; 77 are killed and 857 are injured by soldiers.
*[[1979]] &ndash; The first [[Gay Rights]] March on [[Washington, D.C.]], the [[National March on Washington for Lesbian and Gay Rights]], demands "an end to all social, economic, judicial, and legal oppression of lesbian and gay people", and draws 200,000 people.
*[[1981]] &ndash; Citing official misconduct in the investigation and trial, [[Amnesty International]] charges the U.S. Federal Government with holding [[Richard Marshall]]{{disambiguation needed|date=May 2012}} of the [[American Indian Movement]] as a political prisoner.
*  1981   &ndash; Vice President [[Hosni Mubarak]] is elected as the [[President of Egypt]] one week after the [[assassination]] of the President of Egypt, [[Anwar Sadat]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; U.S. President [[Ronald Reagan]] proclaims a [[War on Drugs]].
*[[1983]] &ndash; [[Maurice Bishop]], [[Prime Minister of Grenada|Prime Minister]] of [[Grenada]], is overthrown and later executed in a military [[coup d'état]] led by [[Bernard Coard]].
*[[1994]] &ndash; The Palestinian leader, [[Yasser Arafat]], The [[Prime Minister of Israel]], [[Yitzhak Rabin]], and the [[Foreign Minister of Israel]], [[Shimon Peres]], receive the [[Nobel Peace Prize]] for their role in the establishment of the [[Oslo Accords]] and the framing of the future Palestinian Self Government.
*[[1998]] &ndash; [[Eric Rudolph]] is charged with six bombings including the 1996 [[Centennial Olympic Park bombing]] in [[Atlanta|Atlanta, Georgia]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[Chicago Cubs]] fan [[Steve Bartman incident|Steve Bartman]] becomes infamously known as the scapegoat for the Cubs losing game 6 of the [[2003 National League Championship Series]] to the [[Florida Marlins]].
*[[2006]] &ndash; The [[FIU–Miami football brawl|college football brawl between University of Miami and Florida International University]] leads to suspensions of 31 players of both teams.
